fields.description:
In scenario where local group has been used in past and would be replaced with a IDP managed group, there is quite much manual work. If the admins could "replace" local group by IDP managed group (in places where the group has been used to grant access), this would be much easier.

At first this could be one-to-one replacement, later "merge" or several groups to one.
fields.summary: Allow Admins to Merge local and IDP managed groups

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When setting -x (-1,-2,-3, etc.) on the *Time zone* Field from the *Account preferences* section from the [https://id.atlassian.com|https://id.atlassian.com/] page Jira displays all of them as *GMT*
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access [https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/account-preferences?ref=jira&src=personalsettings]
 # Set *-1* on the *Time Zone* Field:
 !image-2021-03-29-13-43-47-109.png|width=523,height=402!
 # Type *Enter*
 # The Time zone is displayed as -01:00
 !image-2021-03-29-13-47-17-041.png|width=524,height=356!
 # Go to the *Personal settings* from your cloud ([https://yourcloud.atlassian.net/secure/ViewPersonalSettings.jspa)]
 # The *Time zone* is displayed as *GMT*:
 !image-2021-03-29-13-49-45-485.png|width=324,height=251!  

h3. Expected Results

Set the *Time Zone* as GMT-X when selecting it on the Account Preferences page.
h3. Actual Results

No matter if you use -1, -2, -3, etc, the *Personal settings* from your cloud displays the time zone as GMT
h3. Workaround

Not use the -X time zones, use only the displayed ones from the dropdown:

!image-2021-03-29-13-55-42-780.png|width=529,height=304!
fields.summary: Setting a -X hours on the Account preferences page will set up your timezone as GMT on Jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The 'Restrict to' field of the Next-gen project is available for configuration on the issue screen for classic projects.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add the field Restrict To to the Create Issue screen of a Classic Project.
# Try to create an issue. The field is not available.

h3. Expected Results
The field should be visible on the create issue screen or else, the field itself should not be available for configuration as this being a next-gen field.

h3. Actual Results
The field does not show up in the Create issue screen.

h3. Workaround
Use issue security scheme instead.
fields.summary: The 'Restrict to' field of the team-managed project is available for company-managed projects.

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 13 November 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thank you all for your patience. The sandbox feature is now available to all Premium and Enterprise customers. This means that you will now have the ability to:
 # Create (an empty) sandbox and
 # Delete a sandbox.

For more information about cloud sandboxes, please refer to our [official documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/manage-sandboxes-1019402392.html].

We expect that providing fully capable sandbox environments will be a multi-step journey. Please refer to the sub-tasks for the features we're working on and/or considering. We will continue to share updates on this ticket as soon as features are available. Don't hesitate to contact me directly if you have questions at [mtse@atlassian.com|mailto:mtse@atlassian.com].

Thanks,
 Matt Tse
 Senior Product Manager, Atlassian
{panel}
h2. What is a sandbox?

A sandbox is an isolated environment where admins & developers safely test applications and extensions and preview new features without impacting the production environment.

For more about sandboxes, please check out our [official documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/manage-sandboxes-1019402392.html].
fields.summary: Sandbox environment for Cloud (see sub-tasks for specific features)

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Currently, the Teams feature (from the People Directory) is a great feature that allows us to split our users by our company's teams, as well as by new teams for projects we have.

Although it is a great feature, as the Teams are tied to the users, and not to the Cloud site, it is not possible for users that are not part of a Team to find this team.

h3. Suggestion
Add the ability for non-teammembers to be able to find teams they are not part of, so they can ask to be part of that team.
fields.summary: Allow Teams to be found by non-teammembers

fields.description:
Hello.

Is it possible to add the "Create date" field on the user details either on User Management administration page and on the Managed Accounts administration page?

Also add the column "create date" added to the "last activity" column. It would help a lot on our user's management.

Thank you.

Kind regards

Filipe
fields.summary: Show the user's create date on users management user's details.

fields.description:
I need to support a "Mine" QuickFilter on a Kanban board that allows the current user to click "Mine", and be shown what's assigned to them, or what's assigned to a component they own.

I have been unable to find a workaround for this. Note I can place the hard-coded username into the the JQL, but I don't want to create 25+ buttons in a QuickFilter for 25+ different usernames when this should just be improved in a generalized way.

There are others asking about this over the years I've seen in the Community posts but I don't see a ticket for a request to improve this so I'm opening one.
fields.summary: ability to filter on "assignee = currentUser() or componentsLeadByUser( currentUser() )" in JQL

fields.description:
Let's say you have created an item and you are working on it and you finish it and want to document your work.  So you have scrolled down, and you are entering your notes.  You finish and you want to mark this as Done using the dropdown.  If you are in the item and use the dropdown and go to DONE, and get interrupted for any reason, you have no reference as to what item you are noting now because the title has scrolled up, when you scrolled down to enter notes.  Can you make the TITLE sticky to the top of the window?

 

So, before scrolling...

!image-2021-03-24-16-16-49-481.png|width=699,height=128!

 

After I scroll, there is nothing on the ENTIRE screen that indicates which item I am on...

!image-2021-03-24-16-18-30-188.png|width=571,height=284!

 

Then I go to the dropdown and select DONE, and I have nothing to reference when putting in my notes.  What was I working on again???

!image-2021-03-24-16-21-21-721.png|width=718,height=519!
fields.summary: Tie the TITLE to the top of the screen

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

 

/rest/api/2/user/picker API call exposes user information to the external users despite the Browse user and group permissions being set correctly.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # For any test site, try accessing this  [https:// \{site}.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/user/picker?query=xxxuser|https://%20%7Bsite%7D.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/user/picker?query=xxxuser], it will show user details 

 # I was able to replicate the same on my site [https://dexter1234.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/user/picker?query=mgodhwani]

h3. Expected Results

  If the global permission to see users or groups are restricted, no one should be able to retrieve user information
h3. Actual Results

User information is exposed.
h3. Workaround

No workaround
fields.summary: API call exposes user information hence making site vulnerable

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When attempting to switch a user's role to *Trusted* while having your license limit already exceeded (eg: Jira Service Management: 100 of 100 used) the role switch will fail and the user will not be added to the role however the *Trusted* label will still be displayed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Exceed the user count limit for one of your products (eg. Jira Service Management) 
# In the User management, add a user to the *Trusted* role
# Go to Users and apply a filter for *Trusted* users

 !2021-03-24_14-56-59.gif|width=400&height=200!

h3. Expected Results

If we see the *Trusted* label on users, then this user should appear in the list. If the user does not have the *Trusted* role then this label should not be displayed.

h3. Actual Results

You get an error indicating that you have exceeded the license limit but the user is still labeled as *Trusted* when in reality they are not and this is just a frontend label.

h3. Workaround

In order to actually add the user to the *Trusted* role, you will need to remove 1 seat from your license count to allow space for adding this user to the role.
fields.summary: Trusted users doesn't function when surpassing license limit

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If have dummy emails in the instance, when we copy production data to sandbox, it fails without any error in the UI

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have some dummy emails in the instance like user@example.com
# Now navigate to Organization and click on Products > Sandbox
# Click on any one of the product Jira Software/JSD and select the meatball(...) > Copy product data
# In this customer instance, checking the sandbox instance and you will see only one project copied and no other projects getting copied.

h3. Expected Results
- All the production data should get copied to the sandbox from the Production data.

h3. Actual Results
- Only one project gets copied to the sandbox and no other error seen in the UI.
The below exception is thrown in the Splunk file:
{code:java}
Error executing HTTP request. Error status: 400. Error body: {"message":"Cannot start import - some of the emails use dummy domain(s) example.com: abc-demo@example.com, xyz-demo@example.com, demo@example.com, user@example.com"}
{code}


h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Production data does not get copied over when we have dummy emails

fields.description:
When a user tries to access admin.atlassian.com, if they are not a site-admin for any site, they are redirected to create a new Organization.

This suggestion is to improve the message, to be clear if the user is not a site-admin for any site, and if the user wants to create an Organization after being notified of that.
fields.summary: Improve message for non site-admins

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Sandbox *Copy production data* fails if the group name contains leading or trailing whitespaces
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a group name that contains whitespaces
 # Go to *Products > Sandbox*
 # Under *Actions* in the product table, select *Copy production data*
 # The data cloning will fail with an error message in the backend log

h3. Expected Results

Cloning of data to be completed
h3. Actual Results

Nothing gets copied
h3. Workaround

No workaround available
fields.summary: Sandbox Copy production data fails if the group name contains leading or trailing whitespaces

fields.description:
When copying data from Jira production site into sandbox, the Jira automation rules are not carried over. 

Automation rules [are not included in Jira's site backup|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-75859] and the data will need to be migrated manually using the [export and import|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/import-and-export-automation-rules/] feature of Jira automation. 

Suggestion : Consider the automation rules on the copy functionality for Sandbox.
fields.summary: Copy data does not include the Jira automation rule data

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

 
 After JSON import, issues successfully get created and when checking the history of the issue, we see that the "Rank" is being updated by the Anonymous user, which is a concern to find who is the "Anonymous user".
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # 
 External system import -> choose Json
 # 
 Upload the JSON file
 # 
 Once the import completes successfully, check the issue history and you will find the rank field being updated by "Anonymous user".

h3. Expected Results

The user name should be displayed or if this is Jira system, then some relevant user ID should be updated rather using the term "Anonymous user".
h3. Actual Results

As highlighted, the Rank is updated by "Anonymous user".
  !image-2021-03-10-19-32-47-333.png|width=261,height=196!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior.
fields.summary: JSON import results in history being updated as "Anonymous user"

fields.description:
On Issue Detail View, please provide column size adjust feature for the right most column of issue layout so that the Jira user like me, can adjust the width of right most column to increase the width of middle "issue details" section to get the more visibility.

NOTE: This issue can be related to: adding collpse feature to right column of issue details page.

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CLOUD-11158
fields.summary: Issue Detail View: Provide column size adjust feature for the right most column of issue layout

fields.description:
With new Jira view, the right section display is static i.e. "Collapse" feature is not provided for the  displayed "issue.views.issue-details.issue-layout.right-most-column" right side section.

While using the Test Case tool such as Zephyr, there are 2 horizontal scroll bars displayed for the middle section which is a issue view (issue.views.issue-details.issue-layout.left-most-column).

 Can you please provide the "Collapse" feature to hide & display the right column on need basis similar to the left section and display the middle column wider?
fields.summary: Allow "issue.views.issue-details.issue-layout.right-most-column" as collapsible

fields.description:
Hello Atlassian Team, 

I sometimes get requests from service desk customers who can't logon to the customer portal. It turn out that they are trying to logon to the agent portal with their customer account. 

Could you please take the following into consideration so users do not need the support from an admin to land on the correct portal:

1) Make a descriptive tekst that says that this is the portal for admin
2) Add a link to the customer portal related to the agent portal

Thank you in advance for taking this feedback into consideration.

Kind regards, 

Gert-Jan
fields.summary: Make a a link at the agent portal logon page to the customer portal

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It is possible to generate a report on the Instance administration, containing either all users from the Instance, or only members of specified groups. However, synced groups are not available to be selected on the export dialog.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make sure to have an Atlassian Access subscription and SCIM configured, syncing groups to your Instance.
 # Access the Instance administration at [https://admin.atlassian.com|https://admin.atlassian.com/]
 # Click on *Export users* on the top right corner.
 # Choose *Users from selected groups only:*
 # Search for one of the synced groups.

h3. Expected Results

You should find the synced group, as it exists on the Instance.
h3. Actual Results

The synced group is not available on the list.
h3. Workaround

Generate an export selecting *All users on the site* and flagging *Group membership*. Then, you'll be able to filter for the synced groups on the report.
fields.summary: Unable to select synced groups when exporting the users on the Instance administration

fields.description:
h6. JOB STORY

When I already have a sandbox instance created and I want to test changes incrementally

I want to be able to choose which of the data I bring over from my production environment

So that I do not have to do an entire reset of my sandbox to test the changes

—

Data may include but is not limited to:
 * Global and product configuration settings
 * Users and groups
 * Product content, including Jira issue data and/or Confluence page data
fields.summary: Ability to do a partial copy of Jira & Confluence data from production to sandbox

fields.description:
h3. *Problem*

Currently, when using Voice Assistants, it’s possible to open Jira App, for example, but it doesn’t work to create or work on tickets.
h3. *Suggestion*

It would be great if we could use voice assistants like Siri and Cortana to create tickets and create pages (asking also to add a text on a Confluence page) when using Jira/Confluence via Web and also Google assistant/Siri/Cortana for the Apps on mobile.
fields.summary: Voice Assistants for Jira and Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Several Atlassian Cloud products are capable of sending email notifications to users of changes (Jira issue notifications, JSM request notifications, Confluence watcher notifications, etc). However there currently is no mechanism that the Atlassian Cloud platform is utilizing that can capture if the end user actually opened that sent email/notification.
h3. Suggested Solution

If emails sent from a Cloud site were to utilize [email receipts|https://support.google.com/mail/answer/9413651?hl=en], it could be possible that when a client or end user opens a message in their inbox that it could send this receipt back to the source email address.

h3. Why this is important

This is one possible way in which site-admins can gain further insights into whether or not end users have read the messages sent to them. It can better help manage expectations, and avoid communication break-downs that can occur.

h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: As a site-admin, I want to be able to see if end users have opened emails/notifications sent from my Cloud stie

fields.description:
When reviewing my emails, I frequently have to click on the link to see the current status of the task or ticket. Sometimes this may be cleaning up old emails, and I have no recollection of that task. I need to click the link in the comment notification (or any other notification for that sake) to see that the task is closed, and I can close this browser tab and delete the email. 
 
Wouldn't it be nice if we can somehow see the "current" status of the task? Here is one way of how Atlassian can do this;
Within each notification email, such as "John Smith commented on TST-1234" there should be a small image file with a link to company.jira.com/images/TST-1234.png. 
This image is set to some text (maybe with some colored background). the text of this image contains the current status such as "Open". When I open the email, the image gets pulled down from the server, and you see the status as Open.
 
When the status on task TST-1234 gets transitioned to say, Closed, the png for /images/TST-1234.png is also being replaced with a different image from the pool that says closed.

When I open the email, the image gets pulled again, and I see that the status is closed. 
 
 
From what I can see, you might be running into a permissions issue, because if you don't want people to see the status, that means they have to be signed in to Jira using their primary browser or they will not be able to pull that image, assuming it inherits the permission from its parent. For that, instead of returning a 403, you can produce a different image that says "not signed in" or something to that effect.

As an alternative, you might implement some hash, so instead of pointing the image to /images/TST-1234.png you pull it from /images/some-long-hash.png
fields.summary: Dynamic Task/Ticket status in Jira notifications

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Customers are not able to push data/per project from sandbox to production. This is important as users would like to prepare their projects and push them to production.

h3. Suggested Solution
Customers want the ability to push data/per project from sandbox to production.

h3. Why this is important
Easily push projects to the production site. 

h3. Workaround 
# Take a CSV export from the sandbox and import the data into the production site.
# Or, use the Cloud - Cloud Migration feature (_if it has been rolled out in your Sandbox instance_) [JRACLOUD-72570|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-72570]
** https://support.atlassian.com/migration/docs/cloud-to-cloud-migration/
fields.summary: Ability to push data from sandbox to production

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If we delete a user, e.g.: [user@gmail.com|mailto:cfontana@gmail.com], and then try to import this user via JSON, it will return an error that says that the user already exists, because we store the user as a former user.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Import a user via JSON using the "*External System Import*".
{code:java}
{
    "users": [
       {
          "name": "1",
          "fullname": "Chris 2",
          "active": true,
          "email": "cristiano1@gmaiil.com",
          "groups": [
             "group"
          ]
       },
       
       {
          "name": "2",
          "fullname": "Chris 2",
          "active": true,
          "email": "cristiano2@gmaiil.com",
          "groups": [
             "group"
          ]
       }
    ]
 }
{code}

 # Then, delete this user.
 # Next, try to import the user again with the same JSON.

h3. Expected Results

These users were deleted, so Jira should import them again.
h3. Actual Results

The users won't be imported because we have information about this user as a former user. Below, follows the log that will appear.
{code:java}
2021-02-01 15:02:00,640 INFO - Only new items will be imported
......
2021-01-29 19:14:22,869 INFO - 0 users successfully created.{code}
The problem were entries in cwd_user entry in Database, Jira maintains the information as Former Users, like this:
||display_name||email_address||external_id||
|Former user| |5cc7016878c01800767577c2|
|Former user| |5cc7016b9592cc00762cc8c8|

Their emails are not in the Database, as we can see above. However, the Atlassian Account ID is still there, so Jira can get these user's email indirectly.
h3. Workaround

Invite the user manually via user management.
fields.summary: A deleted user won't be imported again via JSON

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

 

On the Instance administration, it is possible to specify [approved domains|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/specify-how-users-get-site-access-744721636.html#Specifyhowusersgetsiteaccess-Approveddomains], so users from it can self sign up to the Instance (without admin approval). This is a really useful feature to speed up the onboarding of new users. 

However, the UI could be more intuitive: It suggests to separate each domain with either a comma or pressing enter. However, in case the user just enters one domain, and click on *Save changes*, this domain won't be added. This happens because the comma/enter adds the domain to the list, but this is not very intuitive, when the user just wants to add one domain.
h4. Steps to Reproduce:
 # Access your Instance administration.
 # Click on *Site access*, on the sidebar.
 # Check *Approve the following domains* checkbox (if not checked yet).
 # Fill the domain.
 # Click on *Save changes*.
 # Note that the domain won't be added to the list.

(on) The domain will only be added to the list, in case you:
 * type comma after it; or
 * press enter key; or
 * click anywhere on the page; or
 * there is already one domain added to the list;

before saving changes.
h3. Suggested Behavior

When clicking on *Save changes*, users expect that we save the domain that was just filled in.
fields.summary: Improve the approved domain text box behavior when entering just a single domain

fields.description:
As a user I'd like to be able to rename the old domain from e.g.: https://<instance>.jira.com to e.g.: https://<instance>.atlassian.net
.
fields.summary: Ability to rename the site URL from jira.com to atlassian.net

fields.description:
I am not sure whether this is the correct category or place for the bug report. It is not possible to send the "Create vendor" form in order to create vendor :)

No error message is provided to the user. Browser DevTool show the following:

!image-2021-01-22-17-49-50-990.png!

!image-2021-01-22-17-50-08-150.png!
fields.summary: Create vendor form fails currently

fields.description:
When moving from Standard to free plan for JSM, although the header says *Your free plan starts immediately*, users remain in the Standard Plan if they have more than 3 agents.

The warning below does not indicate that the customer did, in fact, have more than 3
agents and would therefore be put on the Standard Plan.

It'd be better to see this explicitly stated, so users don't have to reach out to Billing
Support.
fields.summary: Better message prompts when changing to Free plan

fields.description:
Hello,

I am using Jira for titcket for updating  the client 

I need to know why Jira is not sending a mail other than Gmail

for exmaple hotmail ,etc
fields.summary: Mail not sending to the Than Gmail

fields.description: The customer wants to assign users to be able to edit the membership of their Groups without granting them the Site Admins role.
fields.summary: Being able to edit Group membership without the Site Admin full Role

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In the FAQ of [Atlassian cloud IP ranges and domains|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/atlassian-cloud-ip-ranges-and-domains-744721662.html] it states under *Can the IP range change?*:
{panel}
We will *publish a blog post a few weeks before that change is made*. Note that all ranges, old and new are covered within the already-long-documented ranges on [http://ip-ranges.atlassian.com|http://ip-ranges.atlassian.com/].
{panel}
 * 
 ** On the *6th of November 2020 this list was modified*: [https://ip-ranges.atlassian.com/]
 ** *Blog post covering this time window DOES NOT include this change*: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/blog/2021/01/atlassian-cloud-changes-jan-11-to-jan-18-2021]

 * 
 ** On the *16th of January 2021 this list was modified*: [https://ip-ranges.amazonaws.com/ip-ranges.json]
 ** *Blog post covering this time window DOES NOT include this change*
 [https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/blog/2020/11/atlassian-cloud-changes-nov-2-to-nov-9-2020]

h3. Business Impact 
There are customers' custom apps that *rely on this list to function properly*. Should Atlassian *fail to publish these changes*, and in case we are *not able to programatically update* the list, then it will *result in service disruption*. This *needs to be published somewhere so we can be aware of them ahead of the changes*.
fields.summary: Atlassian Cloud IP Range and Domains changed without warning

fields.description:
Hello,

Currently when you want to show the profile picture of a collaborator if you created the field and added it on an issue card, you cannot see it as by default only the assignee's profile pic will be displayed on the card. 

Can we implement an option where the other User picker field actually shows all profile pictures not just the assignee's?

Thank you!
fields.summary: Show other custom user fields' profile pics

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement

System group trusted-users-* for Trusted users feature is being shown in the Add people section.
h3. Suggestion

Hide this group and prevent it from being shown in the group search.

 !Screen Shot 2021-10-26 at 18.25.07.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Hide "trusted-users-xxxxx" group from users

fields.description:
Hi

Right now the only way to install an app in the cloud version of Atlassian products, is to provide a URL with a hardcoded port 443 and web server presenting a valid certificate.

Atlassian suggest using ngrok as an intermediary.

However, this is a bad idea (see Solarwinds supply chain attack). ngrok can potentially inject code on the fly.

We would like the ability to upload pre packaged apps to the Atlassian cloud products. That way we don't have to provide infrastructure to upload any custom apps.

br
Marc
fields.summary: Ability to upload apps (zip/tgz)

fields.description:
As developer I would like to be able to click on the remaining time field or the assigned to field directly on the sprint board to update instead of having to open the task as this is inefficient 

 

!file:///C:/Users/JANNES~1/AppData/Local/Temp/SNAGHTMLfa91178.PNG|width=467,height=194!
fields.summary: Update remaining hours directly on card in sprint board

fields.description:
As A scrum Master, I would like to be able to move (drag-and-drop) tasks directly in the sprint board as its inefficient to have to open the task and use the move function.

 

Previously used another system where this was possible.
fields.summary: Move/drag-and-drop tasks in sprint board

fields.description:
As A scrum Master, I would like to only carry forward open tasks to next sprint not to "cludder" the active sprint.

Today, all tasks - regardless of done or not - are carried forward. I only want the user story an not done tasks to appear in new, active sprint.
fields.summary: Only carry forward open tasks

fields.description:
The customer wants to add a Group to the Allowlisting that will be excluded from this configuration.

As an example, be able to add the site-admins Group into this list so the users from that Group won't be affected by the IP Allowlist configuration.
fields.summary: IP Allowlisting Group Exclusion

fields.description: The customer wants to be able to Tag the IPs added to their Allowlisting to recognize which user is using a specified IP or IP ranges
fields.summary: IP Allowlisting Tags

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When impersonating a user (i.e logged in as a user), 'Advanced Search' suggests projects that the impersonated user is not authorized to see
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Restrict access from a particular user
 # Log in as user using via User Management: Advanced Search suggests projects which the user is not authorized to browse
 !image-2019-12-09-11-32-11-293.png|width=620,height=270!
 # Log in as the user on a fresh session: Advanced search works as expected
 !image-2019-12-09-11-33-28-581.png|width=678,height=297!

h3. Expected Results

The Advanced search functionality when impersonating a user should work in the same way as if the user was logged in
h3. Actual Results

Advanced Search is suggesting projects, boards, issues based on the administrator's permission who is impersonating the user
h3. Workaround

Log in as user to verify the exact permissions
fields.summary: When 'logged in as user' the admin can see projects that the impersonated user is not allowed to access

fields.description:
Currently it is not possible to fetch the details of the users actively using an add-on. It is a basic functionality that is required to retrieve for auditing purposes on the list of users using an add-on though the license is provided for all of them, not all are actively using the add-on.

Having this feature inbuilt in the UI would help
fields.summary: Fetch the details of the users using an add-on actively.

fields.description:
{panel:title=(i) Implementation of New Features Policy| borderStyle=| borderColor=| titleBGColor=#e0efff| bgColor=}
At the moment, we can't set an ETA for this feature to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes new features. Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
You can learn more by reading [Implementation of New Features Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/implementation-of-new-features-policy-201294576.html].
{panel}

h3. Problem Definition

As quoted below, currently [IP allowlisting|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/ip-allowlisting-998658750.html] only accepts IPv4.

bq. We support IPv4 for individual IP address. If you're entering a network block, we support the CIDR notation standard for specifying a block of IP addresses.

h3. Suggested Solution

Accept IPv6 as well.

h3. Workaround

None. Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
fields.summary: As organization admin, I want to specify IPv6 addresses for IP allowlisting

fields.description:
h2.Problem
Currently, the G Suite UI settings, in the organization admin page, shows the wrong information when selecting specific grous to sync:
{quote}
*Sync specific groups with their users*
All existing and future users to a new group of G Suite users and to the selected group.
{quote}

h2.Suggestion
It would be a great if we could change the "_All existing and future users to a new group of G Suite users and to the selected group_" to something like "_If you specified groups to sync, we’ll continue to sync new and existing users from those groups_". That will make things more clear.
fields.summary: Adjusting G Suite settings to make the information clear

fields.description:
It would be incredibly valuable if we were able to add additional attributes to user objects synched from identity providers/external domains. For example:

 

In Azure there will be an attribute that represents the user's manager. In various Jira products it would be very valuable to have access to this attribute because it would enable us to automatically populate an approval workflow with their management structure. 

 

Many attributes in an organizations domain/idp may be very powerful/useful in any number of Atlassian products, and while add-ons exist to allow extended attributes the pricing structure is pretty exorbitant.

 

As we can already provision user attributes from our synched domains, please allow us to create additional target attributes within Atlassian that can be provisioned.
fields.summary: Allow Customized Attribute Mapping from Identity Provider

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, it's not possible to restrict managed users from creating additional sites. This is addressed by the open feature request [CLOUD-11072|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CLOUD-11072]. As such, it would be useful in the meantime to be able to identify and be notified of sites created by an organizations managed users.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow for automated notifications and reporting on site created by an organizations managed users.
fields.summary: Allow for Notifications and Reporting on Sites Created by Managed Users

fields.description:
Currently the *Switch to* option shows the products and site access a user is having and *Bitbucket* as well.

Please provide functionality for administrators to manage the listing of these products and site access list for their specific instance.

!image-2020-12-07-16-34-30-871.png|width=242,height=277!
fields.summary: Allow administrators to manage site & product access in navigation

fields.description:
h3. Summary
IP [whitelisting|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/ip-allowlisting-998658750.html] access is applied on a product's base, which means that when we restrict access to Jira it means that the entire suite of Jira Applications such as Jira Software and Jira Service Management are whitelisted.

h3. Use case
It would be nice to have the option to whitelist only specific products(JSM, JSW) or features. For example, in Jira Service Management would be interesting to have the option to close internal access for agents, but open up the portal externally.
fields.summary: Allow setting IP allowlisting feature by specific products/features

fields.description:
Would be good if I could set rule:

Every day > Sort cards > For ALL LISTS according to due date

Compared to having to create a rule for every list
fields.summary: Product Suggestion - Scheduled Commands for all lists (Trello)

fields.description:
The Cloud Premium plan is currently not available for Jira Core. 

However there are features in Premium that are very relevant also for business/non-software teams, e.g. sandbox and unlimited storage. 

Business teams should be able to choose Premium features without having to purchase Jira Software or Jira Service Management.
fields.summary: Offer Premium plan for Jira Core

fields.description:
This ticket is derived from CLOUD-3635 to track customer requests for Cloud hosting in South Korea. The main objectives are:

* To comply with industrial regulations of data locality
* To improve product performance
fields.summary: Consider hosting services in South Korea

fields.description:
As a global oriented organization we have a need to have a test environment and also a demo environment an the opportunity to create a playground for users.

As Atlassian now has the ability to setup a Sandbox (cloud premium subscription available).

But now we have the ability to create a sandbox, for each of the products we have. It's still the one sandbox that can be created.

Is there a roadmap or the opportunity to have more than one sandbox. This would really help us of the differentiate topics to do test, demos, etc...
fields.summary: Multiple Sandboxes

fields.description:
As an *Atlassian Account owner* we are able to [delete|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/delete-your-account-976161188.html] our own accounts. As a result *the deleted user will be removed from all Atlassian Sites they were members as well*.

We are unable to *self remove* our accounts from an *Atlassian Site without deleting the Atlassian account* though. This task requires asking for *site admin* to perform the deletion. Admins can also add users to sites without user consent, which is way too much power.

In a *Cloud Environment* where a user can be *part of multiple sites with a single account* we should be *able to remove ourselves from cloud sites* should we do not want to be part of them anymore.

E.g.: As a user I would like it to be easier to have myself removed from open-source Jira site that has long been abandoned by the project owner without all the trouble of asking the site admin to do that, and without having to delete my Atlassian account.
fields.summary: User self removal from Atlassian Cloud sites

fields.description:
When we export the users who belong to multiple groups, it should be possible to export all the groups a user belongs to in a single row.

Currently, when we export the users and if a user is a part of more than a group, in the exported CSV file, every row has a group name and if the user belongs to more than one then there is a new row for the same.

It would be nice if all the groups, a user belongs to should get exported in a single row instead of multiple once.
fields.summary: While exporting users from User Management, all the groups a user belongs to should get exported in a single row.

fields.description:
At the moment, invites lasts for 7 days before they expire.
 The problem is that the expired invite still counts towards the billing/licensing.

*Environment*
 Cloud

*Steps to Reproduce*
 # Invite users

*Expected Results*
 If the invitation gets expired, it shouldn't count as an active license (considering no one is using that account as the person has not accepted the invite yet)

*Actual Results*
 The expired invite still count as an active license

*Workaround*
 Delete the invited user if they are not keen in accepting the invitation
 Resend invite and request the user to accept the invitation
fields.summary: Expired invite should not count as an active license

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The customer wants to know who installed a free Jira add-on (plugin) on his site. The add-on was added a long time ago and logs didn't find anything in regard to them. Our audit logs in Jira UI only go back 90 days as well.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Cassi nor ADA shows information about the free plugins;
 # Splunk also don't show any information about the plugins;
 # Audit logs in Jira UI only go back 90 days
 # We were not able to find the audit information asked by the customer;

h3. Expected Results

Customer should be able to see who installed the app (no matter how long ago it was installed) in the UI.
 I'm not sure if this would be expected, but would be very helpful if we can track the plugin information in CASSI/ADA as well, even if the plugin is not billable.
h3. Actual Results

ADA and Cassi don't show any information in regard to free add-ons(plugins). The app audit logs go back to 90 days so no info in the UI
h3. Workaround

So far no workaround was found to provide such information to the customer.
fields.summary: Audit information about who installed (free) marketplace app

fields.description:
On Atlassian Cloud, it is possible to use Invite Links to add new users to your Instance. These invite links will add the users to the default group(s) for the desired product. 

Although this is a nice feature, it would be useful to have the ability to specify the groups that the users would be added to, by clicking on the link. This would help companies to onboard users from different departments really fast, for example:
 * Generate a link for HR team - share with the team.
 * Generate a link for the Leadership team - share with the team.
fields.summary: Ability to create Invite links for specific groups

fields.description:
Currently, the invite token as well as password resets are valid for up to 7 days.
These will continue to be the defaults but it would be useful for admins to be able to change these default values.
fields.summary: Ability to configure token expiry of invites

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
After site rename, if we try to perform a call via API to other methods besides "GET" it will fail with a 405 status code. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Rename site "abc.atlassian.net" to "xyz.atlassian.net"
# Make a POST/PATCH/PUT REST API request such as [create|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-issues/#api-rest-api-3-issue-post] a new issue or [add users to a group|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-groups/#api-rest-api-3-group-user-post] using the old URL.

h3. Expected Results
The call should work just fine.

h3. Actual Results
We received a 405 Method not Allowed response. Looks like that during the redirect we receive on our end the call as a "GET" instead.

h3. Workaround
Use the new URL
fields.summary: After site rename, if we try to perform a call via API to other methods besides "GET" it will fail with a 405 status code

fields.description:
When I am already paying for 3rd party apps in my production instance I want to be able to use them for free on my sandbox instance.

So that I can freely make changes to my apps in my sandbox without fear of having to pay extra or having my apps deactivated.
fields.summary: Ability to pay $0 for apps licensed in a sandbox

fields.description:
ScriptRunner for JIRA Cloud plugin is unable to perform any dynamic validation on issue forms to link or hide fields like the server version can with the Behaviors feature.

Scriptrunner plugin cannot dynamically populate field values like it can in the server version can with the Behaviors feature.

The reason we are unable to provide this functionality is due to the restricted functionality and API's which Atlassian provides inside JIRA Cloud, due to the fact that Atlassian only provides a Rest API in Jira Cloud and not the same Java API that the server version contains.
fields.summary: Scriptrunner Behaviors not supported in Jira Cloud

fields.description:
Per [https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/manage-data-residency-976763149.html] Jira Cloud currently supports US and EU as data residencies.

Is there any timetable/intention on supporting Australia (AU) as a data residency destination?
fields.summary: Add AU as a data residency destination

fields.description:
it would be great to hide the page title and the page metadatas (watch, share, favorite). 

Based on my experience, confluence users do not need these functions, when I want to use my own site homepage. At best, the site homepage should be as automatic as possible and therefore there is no need for e.g. the watch function.

By the way, when I use the standard site homepage from atlassian, there are no page metadatas
fields.summary: Hide Page Title and Page Metadatas on site homepage

fields.description:
*Issue Summary*

Currently, if we use *tempo* time tracking and set the permissions for few users to not be able to see the time tracking details, they can install a mobile app and will still be able to see *Jira's* Time tracking fields and log time.

*Steps to Reproduce*
 # Install Tempo and change time tracking settings to Tempo
 # Log time on an issue and set permissions to ensure that a user is not able to see it.
 # Validate from the Jira web version. You will not see the details.
 # Install the mobile app and validate it. This time you will see Jira time tracking details in the mobile app.

*Expected Results*
 * User should see Tempo fields and not native time tracking fields in case the user has  Tempo time tracking view permissions
 * Users should NOT be able to see any time tracking fields in case it doesn't have any permissions.
fields.summary: Discrepancy with respect to time-tracking fields display in Mobile app vs Desktop

fields.description:
h6. *JOB STORY*

When I am about to make changes to my Jira/Confluence instance

I want to do them first in an isolated (sandbox) environment

So I can safely test changes without impacting the productivity and workflow of my production users
fields.summary: Ability to create & delete a sandbox

fields.description:
h6. JOB STORY

When I am in need of an empty sandbox

I want to be able to reset the sandbox

So I can start from a clean slate
fields.summary: Ability to reset a sandbox

fields.description:
{panel:title=September 29, 2021 - Media data is optional now when doing a data copy. Available to all Premium & Enterprise customers.}
Hi everyone,

We now allow you to choose whether or not your Jira and/or Confluence media data is copied over during the data copying process. There are still a few known caveats:
 * Data copying for Jira *does not* include data from Automation, Insight, Proforma, and marketplace apps. 

 * Data copying for Confluence *does not* include data from marketplace apps.

 * Data copying will fail if:
 ** the uncompressed XML file size is over 20GB. ([Contact support|https://support.atlassian.com/] if you want to copy files over 20GB)
 ** the production environment and linked sandbox are in different realms. [Learn about data residency for sandboxes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/move-data-to-another-realm-1021239505.html].

For more information, please visit our [official documentation|https://support.atlassian.com/organization-administration/docs/manage-product-sandboxes/]. 

We are continuing to improve the data copying experience so I will keep this ticket open for now until further notice. Feel free to leave your feedback or comments on this ticket below or email me directly.

Regards,

Matt Tse
{panel}
h6. *JOB STORY*

When I have created a sandbox

I want to be able to copy data from my production environment

So that the sandbox contains the necessary data and information I need to be able to test the changes I want to make

—
fields.summary: Ability to copy data from production to sandbox

fields.description: Data created within Singapore borders is stored within Singapore.
fields.summary: Data localisation - Singapore

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 10 October, 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi again everyone!

We have started to roll out Data Residency to the remaining instances of Jira Software, Confluence, and Jira Service Management for instances created before June 30th.  

Due to the higher than expected volume of customers using Data Residency between June and October, we've decided to roll this out in a phased approach. With approximately 10% of the customer base per week, with full rollout being finished in 10 weeks.  We will adjust this based on the new incoming demand. 

The phased rollout is just to ensure that there is a smooth transition, given the sheer volume of customers we have in our cloud, and ensuring everyone has time to turn it on if they want to.  Once we have completed the rollout, I will be closing out this request!

RJ Gazarek

Sr Product Manager, Data Residency
{panel}
 
{panel:bgColor=#ffffff}
 

 

---

Hello Everyone! 

We are about halfway through our work on providing data residency to ALL Standard and Premium users for no additional cost.  At the end of June, we released Data Residency for brand new JSW/JSM/Confluence instances on Standard or Premium.  The idea is that these instances should be relatively empty, and easy for us to move.  [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Feedback-Forum-articles/Announcing-Data-Residency-for-Standard-and-Premium-licenses/ba-p/1732876]

However, we still have some work to do to open this up to already existing instances with data in them.  We are hoping to have this done no later than October of this year.  In the meantime, if you do require data residency, and you are on Standard or Premium, please open up a support ticket, and we may be able to manually accommodate you before October.  

In the event that you have a larger dataset, you may still have to wait until we are finished with this body of work by October. 

If you have any questions, please let me know!

RJ Gazarek

Sr. Product Manager, Data Residency

Hi everyone,

 We know that having control over where your data is stored is a requirement for teams of all sizes. I'm excited to announce that our Standard and Premium plans for Jira and Confluence cloud will include data residency later this year.

 We're committed to enabling our customers to adopt our cloud products. We heard your feedback and thank you for your patience while we prepared to make this announcement.

[Learn more and sign up to receive an email update when it's available here|https://www.atlassian.com/software/data-residency]. There is also a detailed FAQ on our landing page; for your convenience I've copied the answers to a few of the top questions below.

 We will post another update and close this feature request once data residency is fully rolled out to Standard and Premium customers.

 Regards,
 Dave Meyer
 Senior Group Product Manager 
h3. FAQ
h4. Will the price of cloud plans increase with the addition of data residency?

No, we will not be increasing the price of our Standard or [Premium|https://www.atlassian.com/software/premium] cloud plans as a result of including data residency as a native feature. 
h4. Which products is data residency available for?

Data residency is offered for Jira Software, Jira Service Management, and Confluence at this time.
h4. When will data residency be available?

Data residency is currently available for customers on the [Enterprise plan|https://www.atlassian.com/enterprise/cloud/cloud-enterprise]. We’re working hard to make data residency available in our Standard and [Premium|https://www.atlassian.com/software/premium] cloud plans by the second half of 2021. To stay up to date on availability, please sign up for updates at the bottom of this page or view our [cloud roadmap|https://www.atlassian.com/roadmap/cloud?category=dataManagement&]. 
h4. Which locations can I store my data in?

You can choose to pin your data to our US or EU [data realms|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/manage-data-residency-976763149.html]. To stay up to date on additional geographies we are working on, please see our [cloud roadmap|https://www.atlassian.com/roadmap/cloud?category=dataManagement&]. 
h4. Will enabling data residency make my Jira or Confluence performance faster?

No, Atlassian uses our global infrastructure presence to host data as close to customers as possible in order to achieve maximum performance. While data residency provides an additional level of certainty that data will not be stored outside a specific geographic area, our architecture is designed to provide global customers the best possible experience. Enabling data residency may lead to more latency for users outside the designated geographic area. [Learn more about our global cloud infrastructure|https://www.atlassian.com/trust/reliability/infrastructure]. 
{panel}
There are customers who require data residency, but that are not in the Enterprise segment. Either because they are on low user tiers (25-250, typically), and/or because they do not require/are willing to pay for Enterprise prices. 

I know that lower user tiers for Enterprise is something that Atlassian considers (CLOUD-11064), however the data residency feature is sorely needed also for Premium (or Basic) plan subscriptions.
fields.summary: Offer Data Residency feature without Enterprise plan purchase

fields.description: Atlassian announced support for the EU, however, due to recent changes in the world, customers in the UK may require their own region.
fields.summary: Add the UK as a region for Data Residency

fields.description:
There's a requirement for Jira and Bitbucket plugin for PHPStorm. 

Currently there is no plugin from Atlassian that supports PHPStorm.
fields.summary: Jira and Bitbucket Cloud plugin for PHPStorm

fields.description:
Please could you change my url  [https://juananinticus.atlassian.net/] by [https://indicussoftware.atlassian.net/]  

thanks alot
fields.summary: change url

fields.description: Food and Drug Administration (FDA) CFS Title 21/ Part 11 is something that Atlassian has not addressed yet and ensuring our products are compliant as per this norm would be helpful in future.
fields.summary: Cloud products should be made FDA chapter 11 Compliant

fields.description:
*_Problem Definition_*

My company wants our data to remain within the borders of our country/region.

I cannot find a specific suggestion ticket that I can vote and comment on to register my company's interest so I will provide a comment on this ticket to specify my use case and ask from the Atlassian product team.

 

_*Suggested Solution*_

Atlassian Cloud Product team reviews these data residency requests and creates individual suggestion tickets to track when Atlassian products will provide data residency for my geo.
fields.summary: Data Residency - Other

fields.description:
*_Problem Definition_*

My company needs our information systems to comply with the privacy act set by the  government authority for our industry in our country/region.

I cannot find a specific suggestion ticket that I can vote and comment on to register my company's interest so I will provide a comment on this ticket to specify my use case and ask from the Atlassian product team.

 

_*Suggested Solution*_

Atlassian Cloud Product team reviews these industry requests and creates individual suggestion tickets to track when Atlassian products will meet the privacy requirements within my country/industry.
fields.summary: Privacy - Other

fields.description:
*_Problem Definition_*

My company needs our information systems to comply with the regulations set by the  regulatory authority for our industry in our country/region.

I cannot find a specific suggestion ticket that I can vote and comment on to register my company's interest so I will provide a comment on this ticket to specify my use case and ask from the Atlassian product team.

 

_*Suggested Solution*_

Atlassian Cloud Product team reviews these industry requests and creates individual suggestion tickets to track when Atlassian products will be compliant with my industry's requirements.
fields.summary: Regulated Industries - Other

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The emails are from *Atlassian Community* <community-do-not-reply@em.atlassian.com>.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # N/A

h3. Expected Results

Only the opt-in users get updated via email from the group.
h3. Actual Results

The users receive emails without subscription.
h3. Workaround

Go to the Group's main page and either leave the group or unwatch to stop receiving notifications.

!Screen Shot 2020-10-28 at 10.06.58.png|width=657,height=295!
fields.summary: Unexpected emails from Community Kudos Pilot

fields.description:
As an administrator, I would like to have the ability to control and configure permissions to my organization's managed accounts, these permissions are:
 * Ability to create new sites for Jira, Confluence, JSD
 * Ability to create new Bitbucket or Trello accounts
 * Ability to join sites or products external to the organization
 * Ability to remove managed users from external sites
 * Ability to remove access to specific products

h3. Current impact

Not being able to have these controls allows managed accounts to join or create sites under the company's email domain, possibly causing an undesired increase on the Atlassian Access billing, which in some occasions might hit the license seat limit.
fields.summary: Allow Administrators to control managed users' associated sites and products

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Teams were introduced in Atlassian products:
[https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/teams-in-atlassian-products-976161199.html]

At the moment you can tag a team that you are not a member of as long as this team has a user that shares the same domain.

We would like to have an option to restrict team search based on a site or an organisation.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Login to a site A that has own Organisation A
Create a team A within site A. Members: [userA@a.com|mailto:userA@a.com] and [userB@a.com|mailto:userB@a.com]
 # Login to site B that has own Organisation B
Create a team B within site B. Members: [userB@a.com|mailto:userA@a.com]

h3. Expected Results

[UserA@a.com|mailto:UserA@a.com] cannot tag team B because team B was created within another site or Organisation.
h3. Actual Results

[UserA@a.com|mailto:UserB@a.com] will be able to tag team B because members of team B share the same domain.
h3. Workaround

N/A
fields.summary: Option to disable search of teams from other site or organisation

fields.description: Provide native support for mobile application management functions from the Atlassian administration console.
fields.summary: Support mobile application management functionality for Jira and Confluence mobile apps

fields.description: This ticket tracks the ability for Atlassian products to identify, quarantine, and remediate sensitive data that should not be stored in products, such as personal information, credit card details, sensitive health information, and more. Atlassian is considering both integrations with popular data loss prevention tools as well as native capabilities to support this requirement.
fields.summary: Identify and remediate sensitive data in Atlassian products

fields.description:
h3. *Problem*

When an end-user of a Standard/Premium or end-user/admin of a Cloud Free site accesses "Give feedback" they have the option to share feedback that creates a ticket on [https://customerfeedback.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portals,|https://customerfeedback.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portals] but they also see "If you're looking to get help or want to report a bug,[ visit our support site|https://support.atlassian.com/contact/#/]" and it redirects to support.atlassian.com/contact. 

As they want to report a bug, the obvious choice is "Technical issues and bugs" and when they select the affected site, it shows the links to Community and Documentation.
h3. *Suggestion*

For end-users of Standard/Premium sites, add the link directly to Community and an option to report the bug to the site administrators so they can create a ticket with the support team.

For Free sites, add a link to report the bug in Community.

Also, it would be great to have a better editor to give feedback, so users can add screenshots and a formatted text.
fields.summary: Remove "Visit our support site" from Give feedback for end-users and Free sites
